Pipelines¶

These pipelines provide an easy way to automatically parse and store documents (or a single one) in a vector database. They can be used outside the framework by simply setting return_chunks to True.

Documentation¶

rixarag.pipelines.html_pipeline(path=None, html_texts: List | None = None, collection='default', base_link=None, desired_chunk_size=1000, hard_maximum_chunk_size=2000, fallback_strategy='split', return_chunks=False, title: str | List[str] | None = None, additional_metadata: dict | List[dict] | None = None)¶

Process a html file (or file) into chunks and store them in the vector database

Parameters:

  • path – Path to the html document or folder containing html documents. Will automatically retrieve text from files

  • markdown_texts – List of markdown texts (or just a text) to process

  • collection – Name of the collection in the database the chunks will be stored in

  • base_link – URL for single HTML file. This will be used to generate URLs like base_link + filename

  • desired_chunk_size – Desired size of chunks in characters

  • hard_maximum_chunk_size – Hard upper limit for chunk size

  • fallback_strategy – Strategy to use if chunking fails. See regex_parser for options

  • return_chunks – Whether to return the processed chunks as a list instead of storing in the database

  • title – Title of the document. Either one title for all passed elements or a list for each. If not provided, will attempt to extract.

  • additional_metadata – Additional metadata to add to the chunks (as dict). Either provide one for all or a list for each document. Careful as this will overwrite existing keys

Returns:

None or list of processed chunks

rixarag.pipelines.latex_pipeline(path, document_title=None, collection='default', caption_images=False, working_directory=None, original_pdf=None, desired_chunk_size=1000, hard_maximum_chunk_size=2000, fallback_strategy='split', return_chunks=False, additional_metadata=None)¶

Process a latex document (or documents) into chunks and store them in the vector database

Parameters:

  • path – Path to the latex document or folder containing latex documents

  • document_title – Title of the document. If not provided, will attempt to extract from the document

  • collection – Name of the collection in the database the chunks will be stored in

  • caption_images – Whether to caption images in the document. Experimental

  • working_directory – Directory to save processed chunks to. Smart if tex is large to avoid reprocessing

  • original_pdf – Path to the original PDF. If provided, will attempt to match chunks to pages in the PDF

  • desired_chunk_size – Desired size of chunks in characters

  • hard_maximum_chunk_size – Hard upper limit for chunk size

  • fallback_strategy – Strategy to use if chunking fails. See regex_parser for options

  • return_chunks – Whether to return the processed chunks as a list instead of storing in the database

  • additional_metadata – Additional metadata to add to the chunks (as dict). Careful as this will overwrite existing keys

Returns:

None or list of processed chunks

rixarag.pipelines.markdown_pipeline(path=None, markdown_texts: List | None = None, collection='default', desired_chunk_size=1000, hard_maximum_chunk_size=2000, fallback_strategy='split', return_chunks=False, title: str | List[str] | None = None, additional_metadata: dict | List[dict] | None = None)¶

Process a markdown document (or documents) into chunks and store them in the vector database

Parameters:

  • path – Path to the html document or folder containing html documents. Will automatically retrieve text from files

  • markdown_texts – List of markdown texts (or just a text) to process

  • collection – Name of the collection in the database the chunks will be stored in

  • desired_chunk_size – Desired size of chunks in characters

  • hard_maximum_chunk_size – Hard upper limit for chunk size

  • fallback_strategy – Strategy to use if chunking fails. See regex_parser for options

  • return_chunks – Whether to return the processed chunks as a list instead of storing in the database

  • title – Title of the document. Either one title for all passed elements or a list for each. If not provided, will attempt to extract.

  • additional_metadata – Additional metadata to add to the chunks (as dict). Either provide one for all or a list for each document. Careful as this will overwrite existing keys

Returns:

None or list of processed chunks

rixarag.pipelines.read_directories(path, collection='default')¶

Read a directory and all its subdirectories and store them the contents into the database.

Each subdirectory is considered and treated separately. However a directory is considered a single document. The correct pipeline for each directory is based on the present file types. :param path: :return:

rixarag.pipelines.unstructured_loader_pipeline(unstructured_path, embed_images=False, collection='default', return_chunks=False, document_title=None, source_file=None, working_directory=None)¶

Load a json output from the unstructured API and process it into the database

Parameters:

unstructured_path –

Returns:
